TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit WebFormsRootDesigner extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner, class System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerFilter, class System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for the design-time functionality of a Web Forms page and allows access to and manipulation of components and controls that are contained within the Web Forms page at design time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)], must provide its own derived version of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner> class to control designers through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.RootDesigner%2A> property of the designer. Control designers use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.RootDesigner%2A> property to access and manipulate the containing Web Forms page at design time.

block.para:
When you inherit from the class, you must override the following members:
- The , , , , , and properties.
- The , , , , and methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddClientScriptToDocument(class System.Web.UI.Design.ClientScriptItem scriptItem) cil managed

Docs.param: A to add to the Web Forms page.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, adds a client script element to the current Web Forms page.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string AddControlToDocument (System.Web.UI.Control newControl, System.Web.UI.Control referenceControl, System.Web.UI.Design.ControlLocation location);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string AddControlToDocument(class System.Web.UI.Control newControl, class System.Web.UI.Control referenceControl, valuetype System.Web.UI.Design.ControlLocation location) cil managed

Docs.param: The control to add to the Web Forms page.
The control relative to which newControl is added.
A value that indicates the location for newControl relative to referenceControl.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, adds a Web server control to the Web Forms page.
Docs.returns: The ID of the control that was added.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although a control might already have an ID assigned to it, if there is already a control in the Web Forms page with the same ID, a new ID is assigned.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.ComponentModel.IComponent Component { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the component that this designer is designing.
Docs.value: The component managed by the designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner.Component%2A> property is set by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner.Initialize%28System.ComponentModel.IComponent%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.

Docs.summary: Returns a design-time object.
Docs.returns: A design-time designer action service object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner.CreateDesignerActionService%2A> method is called by a control designer and provides a way for action items for the control designer to be implemented in the Web Forms page through a design host, such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](~/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)].

When overridden in a derived class, gets the URL at which the Web Forms page is located.
Docs.value: The URL at which the Web Forms page is located; otherwise, , if the Web Forms page has no associated URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GenerateEmptyDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Control control) cil managed

Docs.param: The control to generate HTML markup for.
Docs.summary: Generates empty HTML markup for a control at design time.
Docs.returns: HTML markup for an empty control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebFormsRootDesigner.GenerateEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method enables a consistent display of empty controls at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string GenerateErrorDesignTimeHtml (System.Web.UI.Control control, Exception e, string errorMessage);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GenerateErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Control control, class System.Exception e, string errorMessage) cil managed

Docs.param:
The control that raised the exception.
-or-
.

The exception.
-or-
.

A message to add to the exception message.
-or-
An empty string ("").
Docs.summary: Generates HTML markup that is used to display an error message at design time by using the specified control, exception, and message.
Docs.returns: HTML markup for a control and exception information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Web.UI.Design.ClientScriptItemCollection GetClientScriptsInDocument() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns a object that contains all client script items that are on the page.
Docs.returns: An object that contains all client script items that are on the page.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract void GetControlViewAndTag (System.Web.UI.Control control, out System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView view, out System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag tag);

.method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetControlViewAndTag(class System.Web.UI.Control control, class System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerView view, class System.Web.UI.Design.IControlDesignerTag tag) cil managed

Docs.param: The control to provide the view and tag for.
When the method returns, view contains an object that provides access to the visual representation and content of a control at design time. view is passed uninitialized.
When the method returns, tag contains an object that provides access to the HTML element for the control's control designer. tag is passed uninitialized.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns both the current design-time view and the HTML markup for the specified control.

Docs.summary: Gets the design-time verbs that are supported by the designer.
Docs.value: An array of objects supported by the designer; otherwise, , if the component has no verbs.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Typically, a design-time environment provides a **Properties** command on a shortcut menu for a component. Therefore, do not include a similar entry in the collection of designer-specified verbs.
